Abstract: This review synthesizes existing research on negotiation, focusing on the complexities of bargaining and conflict resolution. A comprehensive analysis of negotiation theories, models, and strategies reveals the intricate dynamics involved in reaching mutually beneficial agreements. The literature highlights the interplay between power, interest, and identity in shaping negotiation outcomes. The review also explores the role of emotions, culture, and technology in influencing negotiation processes. By examining the nuances of negotiation, this review aims to provide a deeper understanding of the complexities involved in bargaining and conflict resolution, ultimately informing the development of more effective negotiation strategies and interventions.
